description: Short-term bearish continuation pattern resembling a small symmetrical triangle. Forms after a strong downward move (flagpole) and represents a brief consolidation before the downtrend resumes.
validationRules: Must follow a strong downward price move (flagpole)
Volume should decrease during pennant formation
Breakout occurs downward with volume spike
Flagpole should be steep and relatively vertical
invalidationSignals: Price breaks above the flagpole high
commonMistakes: Entering during pennant formation instead of waiting for breakout
Confusing with triangle pattern - pennant is much shorter duration
Ignoring the flagpole - must have strong prior move
Not measuring flagpole length for target calculation
Trading without volume confirmation on breakdown

tradeSetup.entry: Breakdown below lower pennant trendline with volume spike
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Above the upper pennant trendline or above flagpole midpoint
tradeSetup.target: Length of flagpole subtracted from breakdown point

supportive: Volume decreases during pennant, spikes on breakdown
Moving averages remain in bearish alignment

confluenceFactors: Breakdown aligns with round number support
